title: Tacking the foot traffic for Indian retail sites in India
selftext:
Greetings, everyone! I hope you're all doing well.

​

Lately, I've been helping a few of my friends with commercial real estate deals ( We are relatively new to this space ); they've been exploring the possibility of opening/acquiring franchises around the Delhi NCR region.

During this process, I encountered a challenge related to tracking the foot traffic for these sites. In the US and Canada, we have location intelligence platforms like [Placer.ai](https://Placer.ai), which help me understand the foot traffic for a given location. However, in the Indian market, I've found it a bit challenging.

For those of you engaged in commercial real estate deals in India, I'm curious: How do you effectively measure your KPIs like footfall and customer personas based on their geographical origin?

Thank you for taking the time to read through this post.
